name: Dancing on a dream
description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

start.title: The Gang's All Here
start.creator_credit: William LeBaron, Fred Sersen and Yvonne Wood
start.brief_description: Playboy Andy Mason, on leave from the army, romances showgirl Edie Allen overnight to such effect that she’s starry-eyed when he leaves next morning for active duty in the Pacific. Song and dance hilarity follows.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

end.title: Pukar
end.creator_credit: S K Film Enterprises, Boney Kapoor, Bharat Shah, Surinder Kapoor, Rajkumar Santoshi and Anjum Rajabali
end.brief_description: Major Jaidev Rajvansh (Anil Kapoor) and his fellow officer Hussein (Om Puri) manage to rescue a leading politician as well as capture his kidnapper, Abhrush (Danny Denzongpa). The terrorist has been wanted for years and he is finally captured by the two officers. Jai returns to a joyous welcome, and is declared a national hero. He takes a break from the army and returns to his hometown. There he meets his childhood friend Anjali (Madhuri Dixit) who has always harboured love for Jai. Anjali is determined to make sure she and Jai stay together 24/7. At a party, he meets Miss India, Pooja Mallapa (Namrata Shirodkar). As they spend more time together, he begins to love her and she too begins to love him. In the mean time, Jai’s parents are arranging his marriage to Anjali but when they find out about Jai’s love for Pooja, they realise that they have to tell Anjali everything.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

links.description: Featuring a similar stylised set is the spectacular dance number from Bollywood action thriller Pukar. With playful yet intricate steps lead actress Madhuri Dixit, who is trained in Indian classical dance, literally dances her co-stars off the screen.

end.title: The Big Lebowski
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1998
end.brief_description: Jeffrey ‘The Dude’ Lebowski, a Los Angeles slacker who only wants to bowl and drink White Russians, is mistaken for another Jeffrey Lebowski, a wheelchair-bound millionaire, and finds himself dragged into a strange series of events involving nihilists, adult film producers, ferrets, errant toes, and large sums of money.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

links.description: Staged like a Berkeley musical, the ‘Gutterballs’ sequence from The Big Lebowski features Jeff Bridges and several Viking-clad Julianne Moores. Not only giving insight into The Dude’s electrifying subconscious, the scene also puts the Coen stamp on the classic noir troupe of the dream sequence.

constellations_primary.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_primary.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

end.title: 42nd Street
end.creator_credit: Hal B. Wallis and Darryl F. Zanuck
end.brief_description: A producer puts on what may be his last Broadway show, and at the last moment a chorus girl has to replace the star.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

links.description: The classic backstage musical 42nd Street from 1933 similarly uses the kaleidoscope visual effect to convey the fast-paced energy of a Broadway production. Dancers kick and bob in complex dance routines choreographed by the legendary Busby Berkeley.

end.title: The Gang's All Here
end.creator_credit: William LeBaron, Fred Sersen and Yvonne Wood
end.brief_description: Playboy Andy Mason, on leave from the army, romances showgirl Edie Allen overnight to such effect that she’s starry-eyed when he leaves next morning for active duty in the Pacific. Song and dance hilarity follows.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

links.description: Busby Berkeley’s first picture in colour, The Gang’s All Here, is a bombastic wartime morale booster staring the Brazilian bombshell Carmen Miranda. The famous dance number ‘The Lady in the Tuttie-Frutti-Hat’ provides viewers with an escape far from the realities of wartime anxieties.

end.title: Spellbound
end.creator_credit: David O. Selznick and United Artists
end.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman plays Dr. Peterson, a detached and brilliant psychiatrist who falls helplessly in love with Dr. Edwards, played by Gregory Peck, only to find he is an amnesiac and imposter suspected of murdering the true Dr. Edwards.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

links.description: Alfred Hitchcock hired surrealist artist Salvador Dali to create an architectural sharpness in his dream sequence for psychoanalytic thriller Spellbound. Staring Ingrid Bergman and Gregory Peck, the sequence likewise employs complex visual patterns to illustrate the main character’s inner workings.
